content:
Diagnosis
	1. Glassy cell carcinoma of cervix FIGO Stage IVA with bladder invasion

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative intent

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not suitable due to local extent

	Radiotherapy
	12 Feb 2024 - 22 Mar 2024
	Radical chemoradiotherapy 50.4Gy in 28 fractions with weekly cisplatin
	Brachytherapy boost 21Gy in 3 fractions completed 5 Apr 2024

	Chemotherapy
	Completed 5 cycles concurrent cisplatin (one omitted due to neutropenia)

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on first post-treatment imaging

	Current issues
	Grade 2 radiation proctitis
Mild lymphoedema both legs

	Summary of consultation
	Case discussed at Gynae-oncology MDT today. MRI pelvis from 15/4/24 shows good response to chemoradiotherapy with reduction in cervical mass from 6.8cm to 2.1cm. Bladder wall thickening improved but residual abnormality present. No new disease sites. PET-CT from 18/4/24 shows residual FDG uptake in primary site (SUV max 4.2, reduced from 12.8) with no distant disease.

The MDT recommendations are:
1. Continue observation with close surveillance given overall good response
2. Arrange cystoscopy to assess bladder involvement
3. Consider maintenance immunotherapy given high PD-L1 status (CPS 90)
4. Early referral to lymphoedema service

Patient to be reviewed in clinic next week to discuss MDT outcome and ongoing management plan.

	Further investigations
	Cystoscopy
Repeat MRI pelvis in 8 weeks

	Medication prescribed
	Hydrocortisone suppositories for radiation proctitis

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 1 week
Lymphoedema service referral completed

	Required GP actions
	Weekly FBC, U&E monitoring
Prescribe compression stockings as per lymphoedema team advice

cancer_timeline.value: Initial cervical mass measuring 6.8cm with bladder wall invasion
Commenced radical chemoradiotherapy 50.4Gy in 28 fractions with weekly cisplatin
One cycle of concurrent cisplatin omitted due to neutropenia
MRI shows reduction in cervical mass to 2.1cm with improved but residual bladder wall thickening
PET-CT shows reduced FDG uptake in primary site (SUV max 4.2, reduced from 12.8) with no distant disease

patient_facts.value: MRI 15/4/24 shows reduction in cervical mass from 6.8cm to 2.1cm with improved but residual bladder wall thickening

status_updates.value: Stage IVA cervical cancer with bladder invasion showing good response to chemoradiotherapy with residual disease. MDT recommends surveillance and consideration of maintenance immunotherapy.
Good response to chemoradiotherapy with reduction in primary tumor size and FDG uptake
Grade 2 radiation proctitis and mild lymphoedema
Cystoscopy and repeat MRI pelvis in 8 weeks
Oncology review in 1 week, lymphoedema service referral completed
